pkgmetadata.longdescription: Simple Methods for Calculating and Backtesting Value at Risk and Expected Shortfall // Enables the user to calculate Value at Risk (VaR) and Expected Shortfall (ES) by means of various types of historical simulation. Currently plain-, age-, volatility-weighted- and filtered historical simulation are implemented in this package. Volatility weighting can be carried out via an exponentially weighted moving average model (EWMA) or other GARCH-type models. The performance can be assessed via Traffic Light Test, Coverage Tests and Loss Functions. The methods of the package are described in Gurrola- Perez, P. and Murphy, D. (2015) https://EconPapers.repec.org/RePEc:boe:boeewp:0525 as well as McNeil, J., Frey, R., and Embrechts, P. (2015) https://ideas.repec.org/b/pup/pbooks/10496.html.
